visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a polar area chart with the following specifications: Chart type: area, Chart title: 'Polar Area Chart with Normal Stacking', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark theme with white text for labels and titles, Data series: Two series with identical data points [1, 1, 1, 1, 1], Custom colors: Use a gradient from blue to green, Additional configurations: Set chart margins, background, and legend.

title.text: Polar Area Chart with Normal Stacking

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a polar area chart with a dark theme. The chart type is set to 'area' with 'polar' enabled, creating a circular chart. The title of the chart is 'Polar Area Chart with Normal Stacking', styled with white text and a font size of 18px. The axes labels and titles are also styled with white text to contrast with the dark background. The data series consists of two identical sets of data points [1, 1, 1, 1, 1], each representing a series named 'Series 1' and 'Series 2'. The area series is configured to stack normally and not connect the ends of the series. The custom color gradient from blue to green is applied to the area series, enhancing the visual appeal. Additional configurations include setting the chart's background color to a dark shade and adjusting the margins for better spacing. The legend is styled with white text to match the overall theme.
